oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Incorporation of fluorine atoms into organic molecules significantly enhances many of their properties, such as solubility, metabolic stability, and bioavailability. Among organofluorine molecules, trifluoromethylated compounds play a unique and important role in agricultural and medicinal chemistry. An efficient strategy for the synthesis of a variety of trifluoromethylated polyhydroxypyrrolidines is described. This strategy involves a diastereoselective nucleophilic addition reaciton of trimethyl(trifluoromethyl)silane to sugar-derived cyclic nitrones followed by reductive NO bond cleavage and removal of benzyl groups.
